Welcome to SnapStream

SnapStream is a cloud-native video & photo sharing platform built for scalability, role-based interaction, and lightning-fast content delivery — inspired by platforms like Instagram.

Test Credentials

Email: janmk5188@gmail.com

Password: Testpwd@123

Use these to try out the app's media features!

Creator Role Capabilities

  1. Exclusive upload access through a dedicated Creator View.
  2. Metadata support: Title, Caption, Location, and Tagged People.
  3. Upload via Firebase Storage with REST API submission.
  4. Sign-up users are allowed to use Creator mode directly — no separate public interface is provided for enrolling creators.

Consumer Role Features

Consumer users enjoy:

  • Dedicated Consumer View to browse shared media.
  • Real-time search via /api/v1/media/search endpoint.
  • Ability to comment and like media posts.
  • Restricted from uploading or modifying any content.

Cloud-Native Architecture

Highlights of our integration strategy:

  • Static HTML hosted via Firebase Hosting or Azure Static Web Apps.
  • REST APIs implemented via Next.js API routes or Firebase Functions.
  • Storage integration with Firebase Storage / Azure Blob Storage.
  • Data fetched through RESTful endpoints (e.g., /api/v1/media/feed).

Scalability & Storage

Storage Engine
Firebase Firestore is used for fast and scalable document-based storage.
Pagination
Cursor-based infinite scrolling ensures performance even with a large dataset by fetching limited batches per scroll.
Media Delivery
CDN-backed delivery via Firebase Storage + Google Cloud CDN caches content on edge servers worldwide.
Scalability
Option to integrate Redis caching for trending content in future upgrades.

Auth & Access Control

  • Firebase Authentication is used for secure user identity management.
  • During sign-up, a verification email is automatically sent to the user’s email address.
  • Only verified users are allowed to log in and access protected areas of the application.
  • A “Resend Verification Email” button is provided to users who attempt to log in without verifying their email.
  • All authentication-related messages (errors, success, verification prompts) are shown via toast notifications for consistent UX.
  • All registered users are treated as "creators" by default; no explicit roles or role-assignment interfaces.
  • Creator-only routes (e.g., /upload) are protected by layout logic in the (protected)/ route group.
  • Auth-only routes (e.g., /auth/signin, /auth/signup) are blocked for logged-in users via (auth)/ layout checks.
  • All backend APIs verify user UIDs to validate permissions before proceeding.

Media Conversion & Limits

Client-side image compression: Implemented via browser-image-compression to reduce file size before upload.

Videos are uploaded directly to Firebase Storage due to limitations in browser-side processing.

Firebase Storage rules: Applied to enforce upload size limits and ensure fair usage under the free-tier quota.

MediaApp

A modern cloud-native platform for sharing photos and videos. Built with Next.js and Google Firebase.
